result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rajeem E Smith

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 9, 2023 at 10:30 am.

9:47 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Rajeem E Smith in court.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Rajeem E Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Shawn N Woller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Menden provides an update; the matter is still on track to resolve but she would like additional time to gather information about the defendant's treatment and counseling.  Atty. Menden is requesting a new plea and sentencing date at the beginning of January 2023.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:53 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Rajeem E Smith in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Reider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Menden provides an update, she is looking to resolve the matter but needs time for her client to complete some treatment.  Atty. Menden is requesting a plea and sentencing date at the end of October.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:58 AM; Case called for Arraignment.  Defendant Rajeem E Smith in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Menden notes there is no informaion.  Court confirms an information has not been filed yet.  Atty. Hirt will file the information.  Court takes a break at 11:01 a.m. to allow time for the State to file the appropriate information.  Case recalled at 11:15 a.m.  Atty. Menden acknowledges recipt of the information, waives reading and enters Not Guilty Plea.  Atty. Menden requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Arraignment on June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

11:20 AM Defendant Rajeem E Smith in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

***Matter recalled at 11:32 AM with Attorney Eryn Menden appearing but the defendant no longer appearing.  The Court notes the information filed today includes the bail jumping charge that was previously dismissed on 04/06/2022.  The Court will vacate the prior guilty plea entered and set this matter for arraignment before the Trial Court.***
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: appointing Attorney Eryn Menden
Hearing on April 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Walmart/Witness A/co-defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:48 PM Defendant Rajeem E Smith in court with State Public Defender Law Intern.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court notes a defect within the criminal complaint on Count 5.  Court dismisses Count 5 of the criminal complaint noting the State may file an amended complaint.  Court sets matter for a status of counsel date.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
